title: nitty-gritty-detail page
body:
we all know, there are administrators out in the world, that know, what they're doing, and want power over their applications.
there probably have been some issues, that talk about changing internal settings, that are not on the admin-page, without going full-admin-mode and editing the config.php by downloading it, editing it, and uploading it again.

i'd suggest having a *very* hidden, maybe not even with a link to it, page that has all nitty-gritty-details on it, that otherwise have to be defined in config.php.

i'm thinking of firefox's `about:config` or chrom[e|ium]'s `chrome://flags`.
there should be a **very** clear warning, maybe even a (suppressible) alert, that says that this page may completely break owncloud.

the page itself should list all config-entries and should make it possible to self define entries. maybe it could utilize config.sample.php as well.

i may work on this, if this is something we want.

@jancborchardt @karlitschek 
@owncloud/designers
